qas.question: Who wrote Seven Lamps of Architecture?
Who was the author of Seven Lamps of Architecture?
When was  Seven Lamps of Architecture published?
What, according to Ruskin, should looking at architecture contribute to its viewer?

answers.text: to his mental health, power, and pleasure

qas.question: Who wrote Eight Lamps of Architecture?
When did John Ruskin write the Seven Lamps of Architecture?
What book came out in the 18th century?
What subject did John Ruskin teach in college?
Who said "art which never disposes and adorns the edifices"

context: The <b6_0>19th-century<b6_0/> English <a2_0><b8_0>art critic<b8_0/><a2_0/>, <a0_0><a1_0><b5_0><b7_0><b9_0>John Ruskin<b9_0/><b7_0/><b5_0/><a1_0/><a0_0/>, in his Seven Lamps of Architecture, published <a3_0>1849<a3_0/>, was much narrower in his view of what constituted architecture. Architecture was the "art which so disposes and adorns the edifices raised by men ... that the sight of them" contributes "<a4_0>to his mental health, power, and pleasure<a4_0/>".
